diff --git a/python/sglang/srt/utils.py b/python/sglang/srt/utils.py
index b43fe4273..d68fa489b 100644
--- a/python/sglang/srt/utils.py
+++ b/python/sglang/srt/utils.py
@@ -1819,3 +1819,12 @@ class DeepEPMode(Enum):
             return DeepEPMode.low_latency
         else:
             return DeepEPMode.normal
+
+
+def fast_topk(values, topk, dim):
+    if topk == 1:
+        # Use max along the specified dimension to get both value and index
+        return torch.max(values, dim=dim, keepdim=True)
+    else:
+        # Use topk for efficiency with larger k values
+        return torch.topk(values, topk, dim=dim)
llm_reason: The commit modifies multiple source files (llama4.py, eagle_utils.py, eagle_worker.py, and utils.py) that are part of the core code and not tests. It replaces calls to torch.topk with a function fast_topk which for topk=1 uses torch.max for performance benefits, thereby optimizing the top-k selection operation. The changes affect the performance of the existing API operations without being a bug fix or trivial refactoring, and the modifications are testable on CPU. Despite the commit message mentioning "Optimize topk operation", the analysis shows that the changes are indeed intended for performance optimization rather than just fixing a function named "optimize".
llm_api_reason: This commit replaces a direct call to torch.topk with a call to a new fast_topk utility function to optimize the top-k operation. In llama4.py the custom routing function in the Llama4MoE class now calls fast_topk instead of torch.topk, and in eagle_utils.py and eagle_worker.py the redundant definition of fast_topk is removed in favor of the shared implementation in sglang/srt/utils.py. This centralizes and optimizes the top-k computation used by these models and speculative decoding routines.
